tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecurityIncidents (
    incident_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    incident_type VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    reporter_name VARCHAR(50),
    reporter_contact VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    incident_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    incident_type VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT,
    investigator_id UUID
);

CREATE TABLE security_breaches (
    breach_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id UUID REFERENCES incidents(incident_id),
    breach_date TIMESTAMP,
    breach_type VARCHAR(255),
    impact VARCHAR(255),
    affected_systems JSON
);

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
    breach_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id UUID REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    breach_date DATE,
    breach_type TEXT,
    breach_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
    incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
    breach_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT,
    breach_type VARCHAR(50),
    breach_date TIMESTAMP,
    breach_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id)
)

CREATE TABLE affected_entities (
    entity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    entity_name VARCHAR(255),
    incident_id INT,
    breach_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (breach_id) REFERENCES breach_details(breach_id)
)

CREATE TABLE investigation_team (
    team_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    team_name VARCHAR(255),
    lead_investigator VARCHAR(100),
    assigned_incident_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (assigned_incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id)
)

CREATE TABLE evidence (
    evidence_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT,
    evidence_type VARCHAR(50),
    evidence_details TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id)
)
